revised_title: The Evolutionary Origins of Modern Humans: A Review of Chronometric Dating and Population Dispersal
tldr: This article discusses the debate surrounding the biological and behavioral origins of modern humans. It examines the population dispersal and multiregional evolution hypotheses, focusing on the impact of new dating methods and mitochondrial DNA studies. The author highlights the significance of discoveries that support the population dispersal scenario, which posits that modern human populations evolved from a single common ancestor in Africa and dispersed to other regions.
